briefdescription.para: Internal filename string.
Internal timestamp object.
Internal streams array.
Internal ready setting.
Internal attached decoder ID.
Footage Constructor.
Footage Destructor.

detaileddescription.para: Makes sure Stream objects are cleared properly

briefdescription.para: Load function.
Save function.
Check the ready state of this Footage object.

detaileddescription.para: If the Footage has been successfully probed, this will return TRUE.

briefdescription.para: Set ready state.

detaileddescription.para: This should only be set by olive::ProbeMedia. Sets the Footage's current status to a member of enum Footage::Status.
This function also runs UpdateIcon() and UpdateTooltip(). If you need to override the tooltip (e.g. for an error message), you must run set_tooltip() after running set_status();

briefdescription.para: Reset Footage state ready for running through Probe() again.

detaileddescription.para: If a Footage object needs to be re-probed (e.g. source file changes or Footage is linked to a new file), its state needs to be reset so the Decoder::Probe() function can accurately mirror the source file. Clear() will reset the Footage object's state to being freshly created (keeping the filename).
In most cases, you'll be using olive::ProbeMedia() for re-probing which already runs Clear(), so you won't need to worry about this.

briefdescription.para: Return the current filename of this Footage object.
Set the filename.

detaileddescription.para: NOTE: This does not automtaically clear the old streams and re-probe for new ones. If the file link has been changed, this will need to be done manually.

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the last modified time/date.

detaileddescription.para: The file's last modified timestamp is stored for potential organization in the ProjectExplorer. It can be retrieved here.

briefdescription.para: Set the last modified time/date.

detaileddescription.para: This should probably only be done on import or replace.

briefdescription.para: Add a stream metadata object to this footage.

detaileddescription.para: Usually done during a Decoder::Probe() function for retrieving metadata about the video/audio/other streams inside a container. Streams can have non-video/audio types so that they can be equivalent to the file's actual stream list, though the only streams officially supported are video and audio streams.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a stream object. The Footage takes ownership of this object and will free it when it's deleted.

briefdescription.para: Retrieve a stream at the given index.

detaileddescription.para:
index
The index will be equivalent to the stream's index in the file (or in FFmpeg terms AVStream->file_index). Must be < stream_count().
The stream at the index provided

briefdescription.para: Returns a list of the streams in this Footage.
Retrieve total number of streams in this Footage file.
Item::Type() override.
Get the Decoder ID set when this Footage was probed.
Used by decoders when they Probe to attach itself to this Footage.
Internal function to delete all Stream children and empty the array.
Check if this footage has streams of a certain type.

parameterdescription.para: The stream type to check for

briefdescription.para: Update the icon based on the Footage status.

detaileddescription.para: For kUnprobed and kError an appropriate icon will be shown. For kReady, this function will determine what the dominant type of media in this Footage is (video/audio/image) and set the icon accordingly based on that.

briefdescription.para: Update the tooltip based on the Footage status.

detaileddescription.para: For kUnprobed and kError, this sets an appropriate generic message. For kReady, this function will set basic information about the Footage in the tooltip (based on the results of a previous probe).

briefdescription.para: A reference to an external media file with metadata in a project structure.

detaileddescription.para: Footage objects serve two purposes: storing metadata about external media and storing it as a project item. Footage objects store a list of Stream objects which store the majority of video/audio metadata. These streams are identical to the stream data in the files.
